titleStmt.title: Jeff Burnett et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2369

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The undersigned citizens of the 4th Justices District of Hancock County Ky represent that there is a vacancy in the Office of Justice of the Peace in said district occasioned by the removal of Miles Hughes, We would suggest to your Excellency the appointment of Stephen H. C Lewis to said office.-
SeptNovr 6 1860. --

Jeff Burnett
Robert Hardy.
Benj Lynch
Wm Cook
Wayman Cooper
J. K. Johnson
W. G Mays.
A. C. Lindsay
John Swigurt
Henry Paul.
T. G. Lynch
G H Roberts
J. H. Mathews
S. B. Burnett
Wm B. Tindle
Hawkins Tindle
John Probus
T. F. Tindle
J A Clark
H Tindle Jr
Wm Clark
Wm Sterett
Thos Ogden
C. E. Price
T. M Wheatly
Wilfred Hayes.
H. E. Haynes
A. J Logden
Jacob Swear.
D L Adair
Frank Gest
C J Sterett
D Davison
N Starks
Thos Clark
Green Sterett
R G Tift
T M Newman
Baird Sterett
Jeff Richey
R. C. Walker
Jas Burnett
Sylvester Key
Geo Jarboe
Stephen Burdett

Hancock Co
J. P. Dist No 4
S. H. C. Lewis
vice
M. Hughes
appd. Decr. 1. 1860
